text: Why I don't generally give each variable declaration its own line

subs.text: Some variable declarations are code that needs to be read, and others are just declarations and only significant for where they are declared.
By putting a name in a long list, I'm telling the reader to just skip over this shit, it's not important. Some code needs to tucked out of the way.
If code stretches out vertically, slow down. You need to understand this.
